key_title: Key to the species of Beyeria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Euphorbiaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Euphorbiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Euphorbiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves mostly 1–4 cm long, 2–4 mm wide; shrubs to c. 1.5 m high; mainly western Victoria
Leaves 2–8 cm long, 5–20 mm wide; shrubs or small trees usually more than 2 m high; eastern Victoria only
Lower surface of leaves shortly white-tomentose except for midvein, margins strongly recurved
Lower surface of leaves glabrous, margins flat or weakly recurved; low mallee shrub
Lower surface of leaves white-tomentose; ovary and capsule densely bristly-hirsute; pedicels less than 10 mm long; stigma 3–4 mm wide
Lower surface of leaves glabrous; ovary and capsule more or less glabrous; pedicels 10–15 mm long; stigma c. 2 mm wide
Leaves narrow-ellilptic to elliptic or narrow-obovate; fruits 6–8 mm long
